meanings.sent1: The proto humans used simple tools made from stones.
meanings.sent2: The proto civilization lived in caves and hunted for food.
meanings.sent3: The proto explorers tried to navigate the vast ocean with a small boat.
meanings.sent4: Her proto instincts told her to seek shelter when the storm approached.
meanings.sent5: The proto language consisted of basic sounds and gestures.

meanings.sent1: The proto design of the car included wheels and a steering wheel.
meanings.sent2: His proto idea laid the foundation for the entire project.
meanings.sent3: The proto chef created a new dish using unconventional ingredients.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the proto expression of joy on her face.
meanings.sent5: The proto melody of the song resonated with the audience.

meanings.definition: An early or original form or version.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the proto of the ancient manuscript.
meanings.sent2: The artist's sketch was the proto of the final painting.
meanings.sent3: The toy car was a cute proto of the real race car.
meanings.sent4: The prototype was the proto of the advanced machine they were building.
meanings.sent5: The early model of the computer was the proto of modern technology.
